title: Building New Home - 4-Year Construction Rule

scenario_info.name: 4-Year Construction Rule Application
scenario_info.description: Robert buys vacant land and builds his dream home. Construction takes 2.6 years. The 4-year construction rule allows the land to be treated as main residence from purchase.
applicable_rules: Construction period (2.6 years) is within 4-year limit
Land treated as main residence from acquisition date
Moved in as soon as practicable after completion

properties.notes: 4-year construction rule applies. Construction took 2.6 years (within 4-year limit). Full MRE available.

user_query: I bought vacant land in 2020, built a home which was completed in late 2022, moved in January 2023, and sold in 2024. Do I qualify for the main residence exemption?
